Sacramento International Airport is the nearest major airport. Many taxis can take you to Antelope, for quite a fee. If you are visiting, you are best renting a car. Amtrak stops in

If you are flying in to see family, rent a car. Regional Transit is not that effective, and not really safe (The local youth's can be a bit annoying before and after school hours on the bus.) Traffic is usually pretty good around town, weekends are when the traffic is at it's worst.

Their isn't much to "see" here. It's a residential area. Gibson Ranch, when the civil war re enactment is on, can be fun. 
If you really like seeing trains, this is a great place.

Their isn't really much to "do" in Antelope. It is a residential area. There are many local parks, however youth enjoy hanging out in these areas, especially after school, and they are not always model citizens.

The local Wal-Mart has most needs. There is the Win-Co Foods, and it's a good place to get most food items. It is busy, so be ready to park in the back of the lot.

at the Galleria Mall.

The usual fast food stops are in Antelope, however there is a Perkos on Watt Ave. Avoid the Taco Bell during after school hours, the amount of youths is out of control, and the county sheriff is almost powerless to stop them.

Antelope is known to have a crime rate. Before & after school hours is the worst, due to the amount of youths roming around. Avoid the intersections of Elverta & Watt after 9pm, due to the amount of homeless, who will get upset if you do not provide them with money. Sacramento County Sheriff's Department is the main Law Enforcement presence in Antelope, call 911 for emergencies and (916) 874-5115 for non-emergencies.
